$AAPL   
 
Concerning the quarter, Huberty said she expects Apple (AAPL) to report revenue that is 3% ahead of what Wall Street is expecting, citing stronger iPhone production and fewer manufacturing hiccups, thanks in part to strong growth from China in the quarter. Analysts expect Apple (AAPL) to earn $1.88 a share on $118.2 billion in revenue, when it reports results on Jan. 27. 
 
"When we take these data points together, we believe iPhone likely outperformed consensus estimates," said Huberty, who believes Apple shipped 83 million iPhones during the December quarter. Huberty said such figures would represent a 4% increase in shipments during the same period in 2020, and are "largely in-line" with forecasts from BofA's greater China technology hardware team's forecasts.

links.title: Pelosi open to stricter stock trading rules for members of Congress
links.description: House Speaker Nancy Pelosi said she's open to legislation that would enact stiffer penalties on stock trading for members of Congress, reversing her previous opposition as bipartisan pressure mounts to implement an outright ban. The California Democrat maintained at a press conference Thursday that she has "great confidence in the integrity of my members," but noted she would consider additional restrictions if proposals gained support.
